channel.title: Quizzes on AC's Blog (formerly known as Choicy White Boy)
channel.description: Recent content in Quizzes on AC's Blog (formerly known as Choicy White Boy)

item.title: Language Usage
item.author: choicywhiteboy@accapehart.com (AC Capehart)
item.description: I’m not exactly sure why my wife wanted me to take this quiz, much less post it. But she wanted both, so here it is. I’d say that about the only thing interesting about it is that I grew up in the south, and both of my parents have stronger southern accents than I do. My mom is from the midwest though, and Durham is a rather cultured city at least compared to stereotypes of the south ðŸ™‚

item.title: Oooh. Sci-Fi quizâ€¦ I just had to.
item.author: choicywhiteboy@accapehart.com (AC Capehart)
item.description: The only surprise for me is that the Nebuchadnezzar isn’t any higher. You scored as Serenity (Firefly). You like to live your own way and don’t enjoy when anyone but a friend tries to tell you should do different. Now if only the Reavers would quit trying to skin you. Serenity (Firefly) 100% Moya (Farscape) 94% Bebop (Cowboy Bebop) 75% Babylon 5 (Babylon 5) 75% Deep Space Nine (Star Trek) 69% Millennium Falcon (Star Wars) 69% SG-1 (Stargate) 69% Nebuchadnezzar (The Matrix) 69% FBI's X-Files Division (The X-Files) 69% Andromeda Ascendant (Andromeda) 50% Galactica (Battlestar: Galactica) 44% Enterprise D (Star Trek) 25% Your Ultimate Sci-Fi Profile II: which sci-fi crew would you best fit in?

item.title: Nerd Test broken
item.author: choicywhiteboy@accapehart.com (AC Capehart)
item.description: Reviewing links on Choicy White Boy, I noticed that there’s a link to the blog of the Author of the WordPress Theme I’m using (journalized-winter). I checked it out, and saw that he had a “nerd score” of 92. Pretty nerdy, I thought. So, I took the quiz. I should learn not to take quizes. In other online quizes, I learned that I was a satanist, who my “inner rock star” was (Chris Isaac?

item.title: Hooray for Satan!
item.author: choicywhiteboy@accapehart.com (AC Capehart)
item.description: I don’t know why I take these quizzes really. Does it matter to me to know who my inner rock star is? Or how well I stack up against my peers in my successful distinction between there, they’re and their? Still, I saw a quiz that asked which (witch? ðŸ˜‰ religion was right for me, and I took it. I am amused to announce that I’m a Satanist. I wonder if there’s a checkbox for that on PSU’s equal opportunity employment form somewhere.
